DOWNTON ABBEY

About the Iconic TV Show

The History

Downton Abbey is comprised of a six-season TV series from 2010-2015 and two movies (2019 & 2022). The historical drama is set in the fictional Yorkshire country estate of Downton Abbey between 1912 and 1926, depicts the lives of the aristocratic Crawley family and their domestic servants in the post-Edwardian eraâ€”the great events of the time having an effect on their lives and on the British social hierarchy. The program begins with the 1912 sinking of the Titanic, which leaves Downton Abbey's future in jeopardy, as Lord Grantham's presumptive heir dies aboard the ship, leaving him without a male offspring to take over the throne upon his death. As a result, Lord Grantham must search for a new heir. As the program progresses through the decade, other historical events happen that ultimately shape the show.

Events depicted throughout the series include news of the sinking of the Titanic, the outbreak of the First World War, the Spanish influenza pandemic, the Marconi scandal, the Irish War of Independence leading to the formation of the Irish Free State, the Teapot Dome scandal, the British general election of 1923 and the Beer Hall Putsch. The last season of the TV series introduces the rise of the working class during the interwar period and hints at the eventual decline of the British aristocracy.

Where to Watch

The Downton Abbey TV series is available on PBS's streaming platform, Passport. Passport can be used on TV applications like Roku, Amazon Fire, or Apple TV. In addition to Passport, the Downton Abbey TV series is also available on Netflix.

The Downton Abbey movie, released in 2019, is available on Peacock TV, Prime Video, and Apple TV. The Downton Abbey: A New Era (2022) release date is May 18, 2022 at theaters.
